headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. From Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary DOBBIN is expected to leave his Deparlment, temporarily, in a few days, for the benefit of his health, and will probably rusticate in Vir. ginia.
docs.snippet: Secretary DOBBIN is expected to leave his Deparlment, temporarily, in a few days, for the benefit of his health, and will probably rusticate in Vir. ginia.

headline.main: SARATOGA.; Opening of the Season--The Hotels--Arrivals--Singular Disappearance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Saratoga is an annual, and blooms only once a year. It is not yet in full flower, but it begins to blossom, and in a fortnight or three weeks at farthest, will be resplendent with all its short-lived magnificence. Every one wonders regularly as the year comes round, where there can be here to make Saratoga attractive.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mock Auctions. Of the many systematized swindles that abound in the Metropolis, the most barefaced and flagrant is that known as the "Mock Auction." docs.lead_paragraph: It is as difficult for us at the present time to conceive of the feelings which animated the hearts of our forefathers, the authors of our national existence, when, seventy-nine years ago, on this ever-to-be-remembered day, they proclaimed their determination to cut themselves free from the domination of monarchical rule, as it would have been for them to look forward to the glorious results of their independent spirit and heroic virtues.

headline.main: The Escape of Lewis Baker--Statement of Capt. Chipman, of the Brig Isabella Jewett.

docs.lead_paragraph: About the second day of March, I think, a stranger came on board the brig, then lying at Jersey City, and said he had a friend in feeble health, who wanted to go to the Canary Islands and back with me. I asked him what kind of a man he was; he said he was a poor laboring man, and had been to sea some. I told him I would meet him next

headline.main: A Southern Planter Robbed of Six Thousand Dollars by a Gipsey.
ANTI-PROHIBITION.; RESOLUTIONS, &c. Speeches of L. B. Shepard, Hon, J. Sutherland, Gen. Nye, Gen. Walbridge, Capt. Rynders, &c. TEN THOUSAND PERSONS PRESENT, GREAT MEETING IN THE PARK.

docs.lead_paragraph: A "grand mass meeting," pursuant to advertisements, was held last night in the Park. It was composed, "without distinction of party,"--if the advertisement might be trusted--of those citizens of New-York who were opposed to the Prohibitory Liquor Law, and the call for the meeting, according to the same authority, was signed by over 10,000 of said citizens, the Committee of Arrangements numbering some eighty prominent men.
docs.abstract: Anti prohibitory meeting in the Park

docs.lead_paragraph: Three Days Later from Havana--Arrival of the Black Warrior. The United States Mail steamship Black Warrior, J. D. BULLOCK, Esq., Commander, arrived from New-Orleans via Havana at an early hour yesterday morning. The accounts are from Havana to the afternoon of the 27th June, but there is no local news of general interest.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN KANSAS.; Spring Weather--Prairie Storms--Health of Kansas--Immigration.--Territorial Courte, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: A New-England Spring is a mild coquette--one day greeting her lovers with the brightest of smiles, and the next overcast with weeping clouds. But our Kansas coquette is a spirit of more ardent disposition; her veins glow with almost tropical fervor. une, otherwhercs the month of flowers,
docs.snippet: A New-England Spring is a mild coquette--one day greeting her lovers with the brightest of smiles, and the next overcast with weeping clouds. But our Kansas coquette is a spirit of more ardent disposition; her veins glow with almost tropical fervor....

docs.lead_paragraph: From the St. Louis Democrat, June 29. Mr. MAGRAW, U. S. Mad Contractor between St. Louis and Great Salt Lake City, has just returned from the Blue River, having accompanied so far the outgoing mail for the present month. There went out as passengers, Judge DRUMMOND, recently appointed an associate Justice of Utah Territory, accompanied by his lady, and BRIDGER, the mountain trader, with his Indian wife and child.
docs.abstract: Judge Drummond goes to Salt Lake
